complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Set up Elm application structure and basic UI layout
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on initializing the Elm project structure, implementing the three-panel UI layout, and setting up basic ports for JavaScript communication.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves setting up a new Elm project with UI layout and ports, which requires familiarity with Elm 0.19.1 and Vite. It's moderately complex due to the need to integrate with JavaScript, but straightforward with basic dependencies. Testing involves compilation and basic rendering, adding some effort.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Elm scene model types and state management
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on defining Elm types for Scene and related structures, implementing the update function for various messages, and ensuring pure state management with ports.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Core to the application, this requires defining complex types and handling multiple state transitions in Elm. High complexity due to the breadth of messages and state management, with dependencies on task 1. Testing in the Elm debugger adds moderate effort.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Set up Three.js renderer and basic scene rendering
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on initializing the Three.js renderer and camera, setting up controls and lights, and implementing scene loading with Rapier physics integration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves integrating Three.js and Rapier, which are technically challenging libraries. High complexity from physics setup and mesh creation. Dependencies on task 1, and testing requires WebGL and physics initialization checks.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on connecting Rapier to the animation loop, syncing mesh positions with physics bodies, and implementing start/pause/reset commands.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Requires deep integration of physics simulation with rendering and Elm communication. High complexity due to real-time syncing and performance considerations. Depends on task 3, with testing involving FPS monitoring.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Set up FastAPI backend server with CORS and basic structure
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on initializing FastAPI with CORS and defining Pydantic models.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Standard FastAPI setup with models. Low to medium complexity as it's boilerplate code. No dependencies, testing is basic server startup and CORS.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Integrate Claude AI for scene generation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on implementing the generate endpoint with Claude API calls and adding LMDB caching.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves AI API integration and caching, which adds technical challenges like error handling and performance. Medium-high complexity, depends on task 5. Testing requires API calls and cache verification.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add Genesis physics validation to backend
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on implementing the validate function with Genesis simulation and integrating it into generation and a separate endpoint.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Adds another physics library (Genesis) for validation, increasing complexity with simulation logic. Depends on tasks 5 and 6. Testing involves stability checks on scenes.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement object selection and raycasting in Three.js
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on adding click event handling with raycasting and implementing object selection with visual feedback.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Requires Three.js raycasting and event handling, with communication to Elm. Medium complexity due to 3D interaction. Depends on tasks 2 and 3. Testing involves click interactions.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add transform controls for translate, rotate, and scale
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on setting up TransformControls with event listeners and implementing mode switching with Elm sync.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves Three.js controls and real-time syncing. Medium complexity, depends on task 8. Testing requires mode switching and drag interactions.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement simulation controls and property editing panel
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on adding UI buttons for controls, implementing the property editing panel, and syncing changes to physics.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Combines UI updates in Elm with physics syncing. High complexity due to multiple dependencies (2,4,9) and behavioral testing. Requires careful state management.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on implementing the refine endpoint in the backend and adding UI elements in Elm for refinement.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Extends AI integration with refinement logic. Medium complexity, depends on tasks 6 and 10. Testing involves scene modifications.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement undo/redo system and local storage
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on tracking scene history in Elm, implementing undo/redo functionality, and integrating IndexedDB for save/load.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Involves state history management and browser storage API. High complexity due to persistence and UI integration. Depends on tasks 2 and 11. Testing requires state reversion checks.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add keyboard shortcuts and UI polish
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the task into subtasks focusing on implementing keyboard event handling and polishing UI styling and error handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Polishing task with low technical challenges, mainly UI enhancements. Low complexity, depends on tasks 10 and 12. Testing is user interaction focused.
